title: This Lecture â€“ Agenda

definitions.Chain-of-Thought (CoT): A method of reasoning that involves a sequence of thoughts or steps to reach a conclusion.
definitions.Zero-shot reasoner: A type of reasoner that can make inferences without having seen examples of the problem.
definitions.Few-shot reasoner: A type of reasoner that requires a few examples to make inferences.

summary: The lecture agenda includes topics on reasoning basics, chain-of-thought, zero-shot and few-shot reasoners, analogical reasoning, multimodal reasoning, and reasoning benchmarks.
